Description: Fragment of lid with part of flange of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; interior reserved; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of frieze of lions to right (foreleg of left lion remaining; of second only head missing; added red on shoulder, underbelly and haunch); rising rosette and rosettes with red centres as filling ornament; at junction of body and rim, two lines; band of triangles on rim; on edge of rim, band of dots.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2091) (phase 2)
